title: Police investigating drive-by shooting that killed one man, injured 3 others
content:
INDIANAPOLIS (July 3, 2015) – One man has died after officers responded to five reports of people shot within fifteen minutes late Thursday night.
Just before midnight, officers with the Indianapolis Metropolitan Police Department responded to a call of a person shot on the city’s near west side, near Lynn and Michigan streets. When they arrived, they found a man suffering from a gunshot wound. He was transported to Eskenazi Hospital, where he was pronounced dead.
Police said around this time, three additional patients with gunshot wounds walked into Eskenazi Hospital. The victims told officers that they were also shot on Lynn Street. All three victims were shot in extremities and are being treated for non-life threatening injuries.
According to police, all four men were shot by people in a passing vehicle while the victims were standing in front of an abandoned house. Officers say more than 20 shots were fired in the gun battle. Officers are now looking for a cargo van that they believe was involved, and they do not believe this was a random act.
Prior to the incident on Lynn Street, officers responded to a call around 11:30 p.m. about a person in the 2300 block of Stuart Street on the city’s east side. When they arrived on scene, they found a man shot in the left thigh. Police said he was transported to Methodist Hospital and was awake and talking to officers at the scene.
Police urge anyone with information to call Crime Stoppers at 317-262-TIPS.
